normalised: five G Rollout Gains Momentum Across India

unnormalised: New Delhi, India – The nationwide rollout of 5G services continues apace, with Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio spearheading the initiative. Recent reports indicate significant progress in key metropolitan areas like Mumbai, Delhi, and Kolkata.
normalised: New Delhi, India – The nationwide rollout of five G services continues apace, with Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio spearheading the initiative. Recent reports indicate significant progress in key metropolitan areas like Mumbai, Delhi, and Kolkata.

unnormalised: Jio announced its True 5G service is now available in over 6,000 cities and towns as of 17/10/2024. Airtel is also rapidly expanding its 5G Plus network, with plans to cover all major urban centers by 31/03/2025.
normalised: Jio announced its True five G service is now available in over six thousand cities and towns as of seventeenth october two thousand and twenty four. Airtel is also rapidly expanding its five G Plus network, with plans to cover all major urban centers by thirty first march two thousand and twenty five.

unnormalised: The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) projects pan-India coverage by the end of 2025, potentially unlocking Rs. 3.6 trillion in economic benefits. This expansion is expected to revolutionize sectors from agriculture, with real-time farm data analysis, to healthcare, with improved telemedicine capabilities.
normalised: The D O T projects pan-India coverage by the end of two thousand and twenty five, potentially unlocking rupee three point six trillion in economic benefits. This expansion is expected to revolutionize sectors from agriculture, with real-time farm data analysis, to healthcare, with improved telemedicine capabilities.

unnormalised: Dr. Meena Sharma, a professor at IIT Madras specializing in telecommunications, noted that “Widespread 5G adoption promises to significantly enhance digital connectivity and accelerate India's journey towards becoming a digitally empowered society”.
normalised: Doctor Meena Sharma, a professor at I I T Madras specializing in telecommunications, noted that “Widespread five G adoption promises to significantly enhance digital connectivity and accelerate India's journey towards becoming a digitally empowered society”.

unnormalised: The rollout began commercially on 01/10/2022, following successful spectrum auctions. Consumers can anticipate faster download speeds and lower latency, enhancing their digital experience.
normalised: The rollout began commercially on first october two thousand and twenty two, following successful spectrum auctions. Consumers can anticipate faster download speeds and lower latency, enhancing their digital experience.
